transportAdvice: Zakynthos has a limited public bus network that connects the main town to some villages and beaches, but coverage is infrequent and does not reach all tourist areas. Renting a car, scooter, or ATV is the most practical way to explore the island, while taxis are available in the main town and resort areas.

weather.description: Cool and wet with frequent rain showers; the island is quiet and most tourist facilities are closed.
Similar to January with continued rainfall and mild temperatures; off-season atmosphere persists.
Temperatures begin to rise slightly and rain becomes less frequent; early spring greenery appears across the island.
Pleasant spring weather with warm days and occasional showers; a good time for sightseeing before the summer crowds arrive.
Warm and mostly sunny with very little rain; beaches begin to open and the island starts to come alive.
Hot and reliably sunny with minimal rainfall; ideal beach weather and tourist season is in full swing.
Peak summer heat with long sunny days and virtually no rain; the island is at its busiest.
Equally hot and dry as July; expect crowded beaches and high demand for accommodation.
Warm and still very sunny with the sea at its warmest; crowds begin to thin toward the end of the month.
Mild and comfortable with increasing chances of rain; a quieter and more relaxed time to visit.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn deepens; most tourist businesses begin to close for the season.
Cool and rainy with a quiet, local atmosphere; the island is largely in off-season mode.
